page.title: 18Stud Farm,Hutton
page.content: We were shown around the 300 year old farm which originated from a blacksmiths.We walked up to some massive silos which contained about 20 tons of grain.They are cleaned, inspected,heated and sprayed once a year.The cows have calves when they are three years old.120 calves are born each year between September and March,but because there aren't any fields for grazing they must be sent to Mountnessing. It has a pond which is spring fed and nearly as old as the farm itself.The wildlife around the 100 acre arable farm varies from foxes,rabbits and squirrels to kestrels,owls and bats.We were introduced to Jack and Sebastian the goats.We brought a horn made from hair which belonged to Jack back to school.Cyril and the girls are geese and they gave us a squawking goodbye.
